oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Norris Dam at night
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Unidentified couple standing next to Norris Dam's spillway and looking at the dam as it is lit up at night. Caption on reverse reads: "This night scene shows water from TVA's Norris reservoir being released over the spillway after crest of the 1937 flood had subsided. Although Norris Dam is more than 700 river-miles from Cairo, Illinois, it was largely responsible for lowering the crest at that city by nearly half a foot when the flood was above its levees and held back by mud boxes hastily erected."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: New Deal, 1933-1939--Tennessee; Tennessee Valley Authority--History
Dams; Reservoirs; Spillways; Hydroelectric power; Couples
